page.title: 03MANOR HOUSE FARM continued..
page.content: Land management:6-8acres of rough pasture are reclaimed per year by tiling and draining.The land has to be limed every third year.30 acres of woodland provide fence posts and act as shelter belts.Trees mainly planted are evergreens.They are replaced as they are cut.Planning permission is re- quired for new woodland.Field bound- aries are stone walls as it is too ex- posed for hedges.Reclaimed land has wire fences which give no shelter to stock.A syndicate rents shooting rights to shoot pheasant grouse and other game.50 brace of grouse and 800 pheasants are shot per annum at a cost of 1000 pounds.At each shoot lots are drawn to allocate shooting butts.
